00024 /*
00025 Kris -- Notes on how the undo code works:
00026 
00027 At the bottom of the hierarchy, we need to determine the state of the undo command.  The idea
00028 is that we want to separate undo commands by separating them by new mouse clicks.  By holding a mouse
00029 down and painting various objects in the world would all constitute a single undo command.  As soon as
00030 the mouse is release, then a new undo command is setup.  So, to automate this, there is a call every 
00031 frame to DetermineUndoState().
00032 
00033 At the next level, there is a binary tree that keeps track of what map indices have been backup up in 
00034 the current undo command.  The whole reason to maintain this list, is to avoid multiple map elements of
00035 the same map index from being saved.  In the outer code, everytime something is changed, a call to 
00036 AddToUndoList() is called, so there are many cases (especially with building/terrain smoothing) that the
00037 same mapindex is added to the undo list.  This is also completely transparent, and doesn't need to be
00038 maintained.
00039 
00040 In the outer code, there are several calls to AddToUndoList( iMapIndex ).  This function basically looks
00041 in the binary tree for an existing entry, and if there isn't, then the entire mapelement is saved (with
00042 the exception of the merc level ).  Lights are also supported, but there is a totally different methodology
00043 for accomplishing this.  The equivalent function is AddLightToUndoList( iMapIndex ).  In this case, only the
00044 light is saved, along with internal maintanance of several flags.
00045 
00046 The actual mapelement copy code, is very complex.  The mapelement is copied in parallel with a new one which
00047 has to allocate several nodes of several types because a mapelement contains over a dozen separate lists, and
00048 all of them need to be saved.  The structure information of certain mapelements may be multitiled and must 
00049 also save the affected gridno's as well.  This is also done internally.  Basically, your call to 
00050 AddToUndoList() for any particular gridno, may actually save several entries (like for a car which could be 6+
00051 tiles)
00052 
00053 MERCS
00054 Mercs are not supported in the undo code.  Because they are so dynamic, and stats could change, they could
00055 move, etc., it doesn't need to be in the undo code.  The editor has its own way of dealing with mercs which
00056 doesn't use the undo methodology.
00057 
00058 */
00059

00064 {
00065       gfUndoEnabled = TRUE;

00069 {
00070       gfUndoEnabled = FALSE;

00073 // undo node data element
00074 typedef struct 
00075 {
00076       INT32                               iMapIndex;
00077       MAP_ELEMENT       *pMapTile;
00078       BOOLEAN                       fLightSaved;       //determines that a light has been saved
00079       UINT8                         ubLightRadius; //the radius of the light to build if undo is called
00080       UINT8                         ubLightID;         //only applies if a light was saved.
00081       UINT8                         ubRoomNum;
00082 } undo_struct;
00083 
00084 // Undo stack node

00088       undo_struct                                     *pData;
00089       struct TAG_undo_stack         *pNext;
00090       INT32                                                       iUndoType;
00091 } undo_stack;
00092 undo_stack              *gpTileUndoStack = NULL;

00110 //New pre-undo binary tree stuff
00111 //With this, new undo commands will not duplicate saves in the same command.  This will
00112 //increase speed, and save memory.
00113 typedef struct MapIndexBinaryTree
00114 {
00115       struct MapIndexBinaryTree *left, *right;
00116       UINT16 usMapIndex;
00117 }MapIndexBinaryTree;
00118 
00119 MapIndexBinaryTree *top = NULL;
00120 void ClearUndoMapIndexTree();
00121 BOOLEAN AddMapIndexToTree( UINT16 usMapIndex );
00122 void CheckMapIndexForMultiTileStructures( UINT16 usMapIndex );
00123 void CheckForMultiTilesInTreeAndAddToUndoList( MapIndexBinaryTree *node );
00124 
00125 
00126 //Recursively deletes all nodes below the node passed including itself.
00127 void DeleteTreeNode( MapIndexBinaryTree **node )
00128 {
00129       if( (*node)->left ) 
00130             DeleteTreeNode( &((*node)->left) );
00131       if( (*node)->right ) 
00132             DeleteTreeNode( &((*node)->right) );
00133       MemFree( *node );
00134       *node = NULL;
00135 }
00136 
00137 //Recursively delete all nodes (from the top down).
00138 void ClearUndoMapIndexTree()
00139 {
00140       if( top )
00141             DeleteTreeNode( &top );
00142 }
00143 
00144 BOOLEAN AddMapIndexToTree( UINT16 usMapIndex )
00145 {
00146       MapIndexBinaryTree *curr, *parent;
00147       if( !top )
00148       {
00149             top = (MapIndexBinaryTree*)MemAlloc( sizeof( MapIndexBinaryTree ) );
00150             Assert( top );
00151             top->usMapIndex = usMapIndex;
00152             top->left = NULL;
00153             top->right = NULL;
00154             return TRUE;
00155       }
00156       curr = top;
00157       parent = NULL;
00158       //Traverse down the tree and attempt to find a matching mapindex.
00159       //If one is encountered, then we fail, and don't add the mapindex to the
00160       //tree.
00161       while( curr )
00162       {
00163             parent = curr;
00164             if( curr->usMapIndex == usMapIndex ) //found a match, so stop
00165                   return FALSE;
00166             //if the mapIndex is < node's mapIndex, then go left, else right
00167             curr = ( usMapIndex < curr->usMapIndex ) ? curr->left : curr->right;
00168       }
00169       //if we made it this far, then curr is null and parent is pointing
00170       //directly above.
00171       //Create the new node and fill in the information.
00172       curr = (MapIndexBinaryTree*)MemAlloc( sizeof( MapIndexBinaryTree ) );
00173       Assert( curr );
00174       curr->usMapIndex = usMapIndex;
00175       curr->left = NULL;
00176       curr->right = NULL;
00177       //Now link the new node to the parent.
00178       if( curr->usMapIndex < parent->usMapIndex )
00179             parent->left = curr;
00180       else
00181             parent->right = curr;
00182       return TRUE;
00183 }

00186 //    Start of Undo code

00190 BOOLEAN DeleteTopStackNode( void )
00191 {
00192       undo_stack        *pCurrent;
00193 
00194       pCurrent = gpTileUndoStack;
00195 
00196       DeleteStackNodeContents( pCurrent );
00197 
00198       // Remove node from stack, and free it's memory
00199       gpTileUndoStack   = gpTileUndoStack->pNext;
00200       MemFree( pCurrent );
00201 
00202       return( TRUE );
00203 }
00204 
00205 
00206 undo_stack *DeleteThisStackNode( undo_stack *pThisNode )
00207 {
00208       undo_stack        *pCurrent;
00209       undo_stack        *pNextNode;
00210 
00211       pCurrent = pThisNode;
00212       pNextNode   = pThisNode->pNext;
00213 
00214       // Remove node from stack, and free it's memory
00215       DeleteStackNodeContents( pCurrent );
00216       MemFree( pCurrent );
00217 
00218       return( pNextNode );
00219 }
00220 
00221 
00222 BOOLEAN DeleteStackNodeContents( undo_stack *pCurrent )
00223 {
00224       undo_struct       *pData;
00225       MAP_ELEMENT       *pMapTile;
00226       LEVELNODE               *pLandNode;
00227       LEVELNODE               *pObjectNode;
00228       LEVELNODE               *pStructNode;
00229       LEVELNODE               *pShadowNode;
00230       LEVELNODE               *pMercNode;
00231       LEVELNODE               *pTopmostNode;
00232       LEVELNODE               *pRoofNode;
00233       LEVELNODE               *pOnRoofNode;
00234       STRUCTURE               *pStructureNode;
00235 
00236       pData = pCurrent->pData;
00237       pMapTile = pData->pMapTile;
00238 
00239       if( !pMapTile ) 
00240             return TRUE;            //light was saved -- mapelement wasn't saved.
00241 
00242       // Free the memory associated with the map tile liked lists
00243       pLandNode = pMapTile->pLandHead;
00244       while ( pLandNode != NULL )
00245       {
00246             pMapTile->pLandHead = pLandNode->pNext;
00247             MemFree( pLandNode );
00248             pLandNode = pMapTile->pLandHead;
00249       }
00250 
00251       pObjectNode = pMapTile->pObjectHead;
00252       while ( pObjectNode != NULL )
00253       {
00254             pMapTile->pObjectHead = pObjectNode->pNext;
00255             MemFree( pObjectNode );
00256             pObjectNode = pMapTile->pObjectHead;
00257       }
00258 
00259       pStructNode = pMapTile->pStructHead;
00260       while ( pStructNode != NULL )
00261       {
00262             pMapTile->pStructHead = pStructNode->pNext;
00263             MemFree( pStructNode );
00264             pStructNode = pMapTile->pStructHead;
00265       }
00266 
00267       pShadowNode = pMapTile->pShadowHead;
00268       while ( pShadowNode != NULL )
00269       {
00270             pMapTile->pShadowHead = pShadowNode->pNext;
00271             MemFree( pShadowNode );
00272             pShadowNode = pMapTile->pShadowHead;
00273       }
00274 
00275       pMercNode = pMapTile->pMercHead;
00276       while ( pMercNode != NULL )
00277       {
00278             pMapTile->pMercHead = pMercNode->pNext;
00279             MemFree( pMercNode );
00280             pMercNode = pMapTile->pMercHead;
00281       }
00282 
00283       pRoofNode = pMapTile->pRoofHead;
00284       while ( pRoofNode != NULL )
00285       {
00286             pMapTile->pRoofHead = pRoofNode->pNext;
00287             MemFree( pRoofNode );
00288             pRoofNode = pMapTile->pRoofHead;
00289       }
00290 
00291       pOnRoofNode = pMapTile->pOnRoofHead;
00292       while ( pOnRoofNode != NULL )
00293       {
00294             pMapTile->pOnRoofHead = pOnRoofNode->pNext;
00295             MemFree( pOnRoofNode );
00296             pOnRoofNode = pMapTile->pOnRoofHead;
00297       }
00298 
00299       pTopmostNode = pMapTile->pTopmostHead;
00300       while ( pTopmostNode != NULL )
00301       {
00302             pMapTile->pTopmostHead = pTopmostNode->pNext;
00303             MemFree( pTopmostNode );
00304             pTopmostNode = pMapTile->pTopmostHead;
00305       }
00306 
00307       pStructureNode = pMapTile->pStructureHead;
00308       while( pStructureNode )
00309       {
00310             pMapTile->pStructureHead = pStructureNode->pNext;
00311             if( pStructureNode->usStructureID > INVALID_STRUCTURE_ID )
00312             { //Okay to delete the structure data -- otherwise, this would be 
00313                   //merc structure data that we DON'T want to delete, because the merc node
00314                   //that hasn't been modified will still use this structure data!
00315                   MemFree( pStructureNode );
00316             }
00317             pStructureNode = pMapTile->pStructureHead;
00318       }
00319       
00320       // Free the map tile structure itself
00321       MemFree( pMapTile );
00322 
00323       // Free the undo struct
00324       MemFree( pData );
00325 
00326       return( TRUE );
00327 }
00328 
00329 
00330 void CropStackToMaxLength( INT32 iMaxCmds )
00331 {
00332       INT32                   iCmdCount;
00333       undo_stack  *pCurrent;
00334 
00335       iCmdCount = 0;
00336       pCurrent = gpTileUndoStack;
00337 
00338       // If stack is empty, leave
00339       if ( pCurrent == NULL )
00340             return;
00341 
00342       while ( (iCmdCount <= (iMaxCmds - 1)) && (pCurrent != NULL) )
00343       {
00344             if ( pCurrent->iCmdCount == 1 )
00345                   iCmdCount++;
00346             pCurrent = pCurrent->pNext;
00347       }
00348 
00349       // If the max number of commands was reached, and there is something
00350       // to crop, from the rest of the stack, remove it.
00351       if ( (iCmdCount >= iMaxCmds) && pCurrent != NULL )
00352       {
00353             while ( pCurrent->pNext != NULL )
00354                   pCurrent->pNext = DeleteThisStackNode( pCurrent->pNext );
00355       }
00356 }
00357 
00358 
00359 //We are adding a light to the undo list.  We won't save the mapelement, nor will
00360 //we validate the gridno in the binary tree.  This works differently than a mapelement, 
00361 //because lights work on a different system.  By setting the fLightSaved flag to TRUE,
00362 //this will handle the way the undo command is handled.  If there is no lightradius in
00363 //our saved light, then we intend on erasing the light upon undo execution, otherwise, we
00364 //save the light radius and light ID, so that we place it during undo execution.
00365 void AddLightToUndoList( INT32 iMapIndex, INT32 iLightRadius, UINT8 ubLightID )
00366 {
00367       undo_stack        *pNode;
00368       undo_struct       *pUndoInfo;
00369       
00370       if(   !gfUndoEnabled )
00371             return;
00372       //When executing an undo command (by adding a light or removing one), that command
00373       //actually tries to add it to the undo list.  So we wrap the execution of the undo
00374       //command by temporarily setting this flag, so it'll ignore, and not place a new undo
00375       //command.  When finished, the flag is cleared, and lights are again allowed to be saved
00376       //in the undo list.
00377       if( gfIgnoreUndoCmdsForLights )
00378             return;
00379 
00380       pNode = (undo_stack*)MemAlloc( sizeof( undo_stack ) );
00381       if( !pNode )
00382             return;
00383 
00384       pUndoInfo = (undo_struct *)MemAlloc( sizeof( undo_struct ) );
00385       if( !pUndoInfo )
00386       {
00387             MemFree( pNode );
00388             return;
00389       }
00390 
00391       pUndoInfo->fLightSaved = TRUE;
00392       //if ubLightRadius is 0, then we don't need to save the light information because we 
00393       //will erase it when it comes time to execute the undo command.
00394       pUndoInfo->ubLightRadius = (UINT8)iLightRadius;
00395       pUndoInfo->ubLightID = ubLightID;
00396       pUndoInfo->iMapIndex = iMapIndex;
00397       pUndoInfo->pMapTile = NULL;
00398 
00399       //Add to undo stack
00400       pNode->iCmdCount = 1;
00401       pNode->pData = pUndoInfo;
00402       pNode->pNext = gpTileUndoStack;
00403       gpTileUndoStack = pNode;
00404 
00405       CropStackToMaxLength( MAX_UNDO_COMMAND_LENGTH );
00406 }
00407 
00408 BOOLEAN AddToUndoList( INT32 iMapIndex )
00409 {
00410       static INT32 iCount = 1;
00411 
00412       if(   !gfUndoEnabled )
00413             return FALSE;
00414       if ( fNewUndoCmd )
00415       {
00416             iCount = 0;
00417             fNewUndoCmd = FALSE;
00418       }
00419 
00420       //Check to see if the tile in question is even on the visible map, then
00421       //if that is true, then check to make sure we don't already have the mapindex
00422       //saved in the new binary tree (which only holds unique mapindex values).
00423       if( GridNoOnVisibleWorldTile( (INT16)iMapIndex ) && AddMapIndexToTree( (UINT16)iMapIndex ) )
00424 
00425       {
00426             if( AddToUndoListCmd( iMapIndex, ++iCount ) )
00427                   return TRUE;
00428             iCount--;
00429       }
00430       return FALSE;
00431 }
00432 
00433 
00434 BOOLEAN AddToUndoListCmd( INT32 iMapIndex, INT32 iCmdCount )
00435 {
00436       undo_stack        *pNode;
00437       undo_struct       *pUndoInfo;
00438       MAP_ELEMENT       *pData;
00439       STRUCTURE               *pStructure;
00440       INT32                         iCoveredMapIndex;
00441       UINT8                         ubLoop;
00442       
00443       if ( (pNode = (undo_stack *)MemAlloc(sizeof( undo_stack )) ) == NULL )
00444       {
00445             return( FALSE );
00446       }
00447 
00448       if ( (pUndoInfo = (undo_struct *)MemAlloc(sizeof( undo_struct )) ) == NULL )
00449       {
00450             MemFree( pNode );
00451             return( FALSE );
00452       }
00453 
00454       if ( (pData = (MAP_ELEMENT *)MemAlloc(sizeof( MAP_ELEMENT )) ) == NULL )
00455       {
00456             MemFree( pNode );
00457             MemFree( pUndoInfo );
00458             return( FALSE );
00459       }
00460 
00461       // Init map element struct
00462       pData->pLandHead = pData->pLandStart = NULL;
00463       pData->pObjectHead = NULL;
00464       pData->pStructHead = NULL;
00465       pData->pShadowHead = NULL;
00466       pData->pMercHead = NULL;
00467       pData->pRoofHead = NULL;
00468       pData->pOnRoofHead = NULL;
00469       pData->pTopmostHead = NULL;
00470       pData->pStructureHead = pData->pStructureTail = NULL;
00471       pData->sHeight = 0;
00472 
00473 
00474       // Copy the world map's tile
00475       if ( CopyMapElementFromWorld( pData, iMapIndex ) == FALSE )
00476       {
00477             MemFree( pNode );
00478             MemFree( pUndoInfo );
00479             MemFree( pData );
00480             return( FALSE );
00481       }
00482 
00483       // copy the room number information (it's not in the mapelement structure)
00484       pUndoInfo->ubRoomNum = gubWorldRoomInfo[ iMapIndex ];
00485       
00486       pUndoInfo->fLightSaved = FALSE;
00487       pUndoInfo->ubLightRadius = 0;
00488       pUndoInfo->ubLightID = 0;
00489       pUndoInfo->pMapTile = pData;
00490       pUndoInfo->iMapIndex = iMapIndex;
00491 
00492       pNode->pData = pUndoInfo;
00493       pNode->iCmdCount = iCmdCount;
00494       pNode->pNext = gpTileUndoStack;
00495       gpTileUndoStack = pNode;
00496 
00497       // loop through pData->pStructureHead list
00498       // for each structure
00499       //   find the base tile
00500       //   reference the db structure
00501       //   if number of tiles > 1
00502       //     add all covered tiles to undo list
00503       pStructure = pData->pStructureHead;
00504       while (pStructure)
00505       {
00506             for (ubLoop = 1; ubLoop < pStructure->pDBStructureRef->pDBStructure->ubNumberOfTiles; ubLoop++)
00507             {
00508                   // this loop won't execute for single-tile structures; for multi-tile structures, we have to
00509                   // add to the undo list all the other tiles covered by the structure
00510                   iCoveredMapIndex = pStructure->sBaseGridNo + pStructure->pDBStructureRef->ppTile[ubLoop]->sPosRelToBase;
00511                   AddToUndoList( iCoveredMapIndex );
00512             }
00513             pStructure = pStructure->pNext;
00514       }
00515 
00516       CropStackToMaxLength( MAX_UNDO_COMMAND_LENGTH );
00517 
00518       return( TRUE );
00519 }
00520 
00521 
00522 void CheckMapIndexForMultiTileStructures( UINT16 usMapIndex )
00523 {
00524       STRUCTURE *       pStructure;
00525       UINT8                         ubLoop;
00526       INT32                         iCoveredMapIndex;
00527 
00528       pStructure = gpWorldLevelData[usMapIndex].pStructureHead;
00529       while (pStructure)
00530       {
00531             if (pStructure->pDBStructureRef->pDBStructure->ubNumberOfTiles > 1)
00532             {
00533                   for (ubLoop = 0; ubLoop < pStructure->pDBStructureRef->pDBStructure->ubNumberOfTiles; ubLoop++)
00534                   {
00535                         // for multi-tile structures we have to add, to the undo list, all the other tiles covered by the structure
00536                         if (pStructure->fFlags & STRUCTURE_BASE_TILE)
00537                         {
00538                               iCoveredMapIndex = usMapIndex + pStructure->pDBStructureRef->ppTile[ubLoop]->sPosRelToBase;
00539                         }
00540                         else
00541                         {
00542                               iCoveredMapIndex = pStructure->sBaseGridNo + pStructure->pDBStructureRef->ppTile[ubLoop]->sPosRelToBase;
00543                         }
00544                         AddToUndoList( iCoveredMapIndex );
00545                   }
00546             }
00547             pStructure = pStructure->pNext;
00548       }
00549 }
00550 
00551 void CheckForMultiTilesInTreeAndAddToUndoList( MapIndexBinaryTree *node )
00552 {
00553       CheckMapIndexForMultiTileStructures( node->usMapIndex );
00554       if( node->left ) 
00555             CheckForMultiTilesInTreeAndAddToUndoList( node->left );
00556       if( node->right ) 
00557             CheckForMultiTilesInTreeAndAddToUndoList( node->right );
00558 }
00559 
00560 BOOLEAN RemoveAllFromUndoList( void )
00561 {
00562       ClearUndoMapIndexTree();
00563 
00564       while ( gpTileUndoStack != NULL )
00565             DeleteTopStackNode();
00566 
00567       return( TRUE );
00568 }
00569 
00570 
00571 BOOLEAN ExecuteUndoList( void )
00572 {
00573       INT32                   iCmdCount, iCurCount;
00574       INT32                   iUndoMapIndex;
00575       BOOLEAN                 fExitGrid;
00576 
00577       if(   !gfUndoEnabled )
00578             return FALSE;
00579 
00580       // Is there something on the undo stack?
00581       if ( gpTileUndoStack == NULL )
00582             return( TRUE );
00583 
00584       // Get number of stack entries for this command (top node will tell this)
00585       iCmdCount = gpTileUndoStack->iCmdCount;
00586 
00587       // Execute each stack node in command, and remove each from stack.
00588       iCurCount = 0;
00589       while ( (iCurCount < iCmdCount) && (gpTileUndoStack != NULL) )
00590       {
00591             iUndoMapIndex = gpTileUndoStack->pData->iMapIndex;
00592 
00593             // Find which map tile we are to "undo"
00594             if( gpTileUndoStack->pData->fLightSaved )
00595             { //We saved a light, so delete that light
00596                   INT16 sX, sY;
00597                   //Turn on this flag so that the following code, when executed, doesn't attempt to
00598                   //add lights to the undo list.  That would cause problems...
00599                   gfIgnoreUndoCmdsForLights = TRUE;
00600                   ConvertGridNoToXY( (INT16)iUndoMapIndex, &sX, &sY );
00601                   if( !gpTileUndoStack->pData->ubLightRadius )
00602                         RemoveLight( sX, sY );
00603                   else
00604                         PlaceLight( gpTileUndoStack->pData->ubLightRadius, sX, sY, gpTileUndoStack->pData->ubLightID );
00605                   //Turn off the flag so lights can again be added to the undo list.
00606                   gfIgnoreUndoCmdsForLights = FALSE;
00607             }
00608             else
00609             {     // We execute the undo command node by simply swapping the contents
00610                   // of the undo's MAP_ELEMENT with the world's element.
00611                   fExitGrid = ExitGridAtGridNo( (UINT16)iUndoMapIndex );
00612                   SwapMapElementWithWorld( iUndoMapIndex, gpTileUndoStack->pData->pMapTile );
00613 
00614                   // copy the room number information back 
00615                   gubWorldRoomInfo[ iUndoMapIndex ] = gpTileUndoStack->pData->ubRoomNum;
00616 
00617                   // Now we smooth out the changes...
00618                   //SmoothUndoMapTileTerrain( iUndoMapIndex, gpTileUndoStack->pData->pMapTile );
00619                   SmoothAllTerrainTypeRadius( iUndoMapIndex, 1, TRUE );
00620             }
00621 
00622             // ...trash the top element of the stack...
00623             DeleteTopStackNode( );
00624 
00625             // ...and bump the command counter up by 1
00626             iCurCount++;
00627 
00628             //Kris:
00629             //The new cursor system is somehow interfering with the undo stuff.  When
00630             //an undo is called, the item is erased, but a cursor is added!  I'm quickly
00631             //hacking around this by erasing all cursors here.
00632             RemoveAllTopmostsOfTypeRange( iUndoMapIndex, FIRSTPOINTERS, FIRSTPOINTERS );
00633 
00634             if( fExitGrid && !ExitGridAtGridNo( (UINT16)iUndoMapIndex ) )
00635             { //An exitgrid has been removed, so get rid of the associated indicator.
00636                   RemoveTopmost( (UINT16)iUndoMapIndex, FIRSTPOINTERS8 );
00637             }
00638             else if( !fExitGrid && ExitGridAtGridNo( (UINT16)iUndoMapIndex ) )
00639             { //An exitgrid has been added, so add the associated indicator
00640                   AddTopmostToTail( (UINT16)iUndoMapIndex, FIRSTPOINTERS8 );
00641             }
00642       }
00643 
00644       return( TRUE );
00645 }
00646 
00647 
00648 void SmoothUndoMapTileTerrain( INT32 iWorldTile, MAP_ELEMENT *pUndoTile )
00649 {
00650       LEVELNODE   *pWorldLand;
00651       LEVELNODE *pUndoLand;
00652       LEVELNODE *pLand;
00653       LEVELNODE *pWLand;
00654       UINT32            uiCheckType, uiWCheckType;
00655       BOOLEAN           fFound;
00656 
00657       pUndoLand = pUndoTile->pLandHead;
00658       pWorldLand = gpWorldLevelData[ iWorldTile ].pLandHead;
00659 
00660       if ( pUndoLand == NULL )
00661       {
00662             // nothing in the old tile, so smooth the entire land in world's tile
00663             pLand = gpWorldLevelData[ iWorldTile ].pLandHead;
00664             while( pLand != NULL )
00665             {
00666                   GetTileType( pLand->usIndex, &uiCheckType );
00667                   SmoothTerrainRadius( iWorldTile, uiCheckType, 1, TRUE );
00668                   pLand = pLand->pNext;
00669             }
00670       }
00671       else if ( gpWorldLevelData[ iWorldTile ].pLandHead == NULL ) 
00672       {
00673             // Nothing in world's tile, so smooth out the land in the old tile.
00674             pLand = pUndoLand;
00675             while( pLand != NULL )
00676             {
00677                   GetTileType( pLand->usIndex, &uiCheckType );
00678                   SmoothTerrainRadius( iWorldTile, uiCheckType, 1, TRUE );
00679                   pLand = pLand->pNext;
00680             }
00681       }
00682       else
00683       {
00684             pLand = pUndoLand;
00685             while( pLand != NULL )
00686             {
00687                   GetTileType( pLand->usIndex, &uiCheckType);
00688 
00689                   fFound = FALSE;
00690                   pWLand = pWorldLand;
00691                   while( pWLand != NULL && !fFound )
00692                   {
00693                         GetTileType( pWLand->usIndex, &uiWCheckType);
00694                         
00695                         if ( uiCheckType == uiWCheckType )
00696                               fFound = TRUE;
00697 
00698                         pWLand = pWLand->pNext;
00699                   }
00700 
00701                   if ( !fFound )
00702                         SmoothTerrainRadius( iWorldTile, uiCheckType, 1, TRUE );
00703 
00704                   pLand = pLand->pNext;
00705             }
00706 
00707             pWLand = pWorldLand;
00708             while( pWLand != NULL )
00709             {
00710                   GetTileType( pWLand->usIndex, &uiWCheckType);
00711 
00712                   fFound = FALSE;
00713                   pLand = pUndoLand;
00714                   while( pLand != NULL && !fFound )
00715                   {
00716                         GetTileType( pLand->usIndex, &uiCheckType);
00717                         
00718                         if ( uiCheckType == uiWCheckType )
00719                               fFound = TRUE;
00720 
00721                         pLand = pLand->pNext;
00722                   }
00723 
00724                   if ( !fFound )
00725                         SmoothTerrainRadius( iWorldTile, uiWCheckType, 1, TRUE );
00726 
00727                   pWLand = pWLand->pNext;
00728             }
00729       }
00730 }
00731 
00732 //Because of the potentially huge amounts of memory that can be allocated due to the inefficient
00733 //undo methods coded by Bret, it is feasible that it could fail.  Instead of using assertions to
00734 //terminate the program, destroy the memory allocated thusfar.
00735 void DeleteMapElementContentsAfterCreationFail( MAP_ELEMENT *pNewMapElement )
00736 {
00737       LEVELNODE *pLevelNode;
00738       STRUCTURE *pStructure;
00739       INT32 x;
00740       for( x = 0; x < 9; x++ )
00741       {
00742             if( x == 1 )
00743                   continue;
00744             pLevelNode = pNewMapElement->pLevelNodes[ x ];
00745             while( pLevelNode )
00746             {
00747                   LEVELNODE *temp;
00748                   temp = pLevelNode;
00749                   pLevelNode = pLevelNode->pNext;
00750                   MemFree( temp );
00751             }
00752       }
00753       pStructure = pNewMapElement->pStructureHead;
00754       while( pStructure )
00755       {
00756             STRUCTURE *temp;
00757             temp = pStructure;
00758             pStructure = pStructure->pNext;
00759             MemFree( temp );
00760       }
00761 }
00762 
00763 /*
00764       union 
00765       {
00766             struct TAG_level_node                     *pPrevNode;                         // FOR LAND, GOING BACKWARDS POINTER
00767             ITEM_POOL                                                         *pItemPool;                         // ITEM POOLS
00768             STRUCTURE                                                         *pStructureData;        // STRUCTURE DATA
00769             INT32                                                                   iPhysicsObjectID;       // ID FOR PHYSICS ITEM
00770             INT32                                                                   uiAPCost;                                 // FOR AP DISPLAY
00771       }; // ( 4 byte union )
00772       union 
00773       {
00774             struct
00775             {
00776                   UINT16                                                            usIndex;                                        // TILE DATABASE INDEX
00777                   INT16                                                             sCurrentFrame;                      // Stuff for animated tiles for a given tile location ( doors, etc )
00778             };
00779             struct
00780             {
00781                   SOLDIERTYPE                                           *pSoldier;                          // POINTER TO SOLDIER
00782             };
00783       }; // ( 4 byte union )
00784 */
00785 BOOLEAN CopyMapElementFromWorld( MAP_ELEMENT *pNewMapElement, INT32 iMapIndex )
00786 {
00787       MAP_ELEMENT             *pOldMapElement;
00788       LEVELNODE                     *pOldLevelNode;
00789       LEVELNODE                 *pLevelNode;
00790       LEVELNODE                     *pNewLevelNode;
00791       LEVELNODE                     *tail;
00792       INT32                               x;
00793 
00794       STRUCTURE                     *pOldStructure;
00795 
00796       //Get a pointer to the current map index
00797       pOldMapElement = &gpWorldLevelData[ iMapIndex ];
00798 
00799       //Save the structure information from the mapelement
00800       pOldStructure = pOldMapElement->pStructureHead;
00801       if( pOldStructure )
00802       {
00803             STRUCTURE                     *pNewStructure;
00804             STRUCTURE                     *pStructure;
00805             STRUCTURE                     *tail;
00806             tail = NULL;
00807             pNewStructure = NULL;
00808             while( pOldStructure )
00809             {
00810                   pStructure = (STRUCTURE*)MemAlloc( sizeof( STRUCTURE ) );
00811                   if( !pStructure )
00812                   {
00813                         DeleteMapElementContentsAfterCreationFail( pNewMapElement );
00814                         return FALSE;
00815                   }
00816                   if( !tail )
00817                   { //first node in structure list
00818                         tail = pStructure;
00819                         *tail = *pOldStructure;
00820                         tail->pPrev = NULL;
00821                         tail->pNext = NULL;
00822                   }
00823                   else
00824                   { //add to the end of the levelnode list
00825                         tail->pNext = pStructure;
00826                         *pStructure = *pOldStructure;
00827                         pStructure->pPrev = tail;
00828                         pStructure->pNext = NULL;
00829                         tail = tail->pNext;
00830                   }
00831                   //place the new node inside of the new map element
00832                   if( !pNewStructure )
00833                   {
00834                     pNewMapElement->pStructureHead = pStructure;
00835                         pNewStructure = pStructure;
00836                   }
00837                   else
00838                   {
00839                         pNewStructure->pNext = pStructure;
00840                         pNewStructure = pNewStructure->pNext;
00841                   }
00842                   pOldStructure = pOldStructure->pNext;
00843             }
00844             if( tail )
00845             {
00846                   pNewMapElement->pStructureTail = tail;
00847             }
00848       }
00849 
00850       //For each of the 9 levelnodes, save each one
00851       //except for levelnode[1] which is a pointer to the first land to render.
00852       for( x = 0; x < 9; x++ )
00853       {
00854             if( x == 1 || x == 5 ) //skip the pLandStart and pMercLevel LEVELNODES
00855                   continue;
00856             tail = NULL;
00857             pOldLevelNode = pOldMapElement->pLevelNodes[ x ];
00858             pNewLevelNode = NULL;
00859             while( pOldLevelNode )
00860             {
00861                   //copy the level node
00862                   pLevelNode = ( LEVELNODE* )MemAlloc( sizeof( LEVELNODE ) );
00863                   if( !pLevelNode )
00864                   {
00865                         DeleteMapElementContentsAfterCreationFail( pNewMapElement );
00866                         return FALSE;
00867                   }
00868                   if( !tail )
00869                   { //first node in levelnode list
00870                         tail = pLevelNode;
00871                         *tail = *pOldLevelNode;
00872                         if( !x ) //land layer only
00873                               tail->pPrevNode = NULL;
00874                         tail->pNext = NULL;
00875                   }
00876                   else
00877                   { //add to the end of the levelnode list
00878                         tail->pNext = pLevelNode;
00879                         *pLevelNode = *pOldLevelNode;
00880                         if( !x ) //land layer only
00881                               pLevelNode->pPrevNode = tail;
00882                         pLevelNode->pNext = NULL;
00883                         tail = tail->pNext;
00884                   }
00885                   //place the new node inside of the new map element
00886                   if( !pNewLevelNode )
00887                   {
00888                     pNewMapElement->pLevelNodes[ x ] = pLevelNode;
00889                         pNewLevelNode = pLevelNode;
00890                   }
00891                   else
00892                   {
00893                         pNewLevelNode->pNext = pLevelNode;
00894                         pNewLevelNode = pNewLevelNode->pNext;
00895                   }
00896                   //Handle levelnode layer specific stuff
00897                   switch( x )
00898                   {
00899                         case 0: //LAND LAYER
00900                               if( pOldLevelNode == pOldMapElement->pLandStart )
00901                               { //set the new landstart to point to the new levelnode.
00902                                     pNewMapElement->pLandStart = pNewLevelNode;
00903                               }
00904                               break;
00905                         case 2: //OBJECT LAYER
00906                               if( pOldLevelNode->pItemPool )
00907                               { //save the item pool?
00908                                     //pNewLevelNode->pItemPool = (ITEM_POOL*)MemAlloc( sizeof( ITEM_POOL ) );
00909                               }
00910                               break;
00911                         case 3: //STRUCT LAYER
00912                         case 6:     //ROOF LAYER
00913                         case 7: //ON ROOF LAYER
00914                               if( pOldLevelNode->pStructureData )
00915                               { //make sure the structuredata pointer points to the parallel structure
00916                                     STRUCTURE *pOld, *pNew;
00917                                     //both lists are exactly the same size and contain the same information,
00918                                     //but the addresses are different.  We will traverse the old list until
00919                                     //we find the match, then
00920                                     pOld = pOldMapElement->pStructureHead;
00921                                     pNew = pNewMapElement->pStructureHead;
00922                                     while( pOld )
00923                                     {
00924                                           Assert( pNew );
00925                                           if( pOld == pOldLevelNode->pStructureData )
00926                                           {
00927                                                 pNewLevelNode->pStructureData = pNew;
00928                                                 break;
00929                                           }
00930                                           pOld = pOld->pNext;
00931                                           pNew = pNew->pNext;
00932                                     }
00933                                     //Kris:
00934                                     //If this assert should fail, that means there is something wrong with
00935                                     //the preservation of the structure data within the mapelement.  
00936                                     if( pOld != pOldLevelNode->pStructureData )
00937                                     {
00938                                           //OUCH!!! THIS IS HAPPENING.  DISABLED IT FOR LINDA'S SAKE
00939                                           Assert( 1 );
00940                                     }
00941                               }
00942                               break;
00943                   }
00944                   //Done, go to next node in this level
00945                   pOldLevelNode = pOldLevelNode->pNext;
00946             }
00947             //Done, go to next level
00948       }
00949 
00950       //Save the rest of the information in the mapelement.
00951       pNewMapElement->uiFlags                                     = pOldMapElement->uiFlags;
00952       pNewMapElement->sSumRealLights[0]         = pOldMapElement->sSumRealLights[0];
00953       pNewMapElement->sSumRealLights[1]         = pOldMapElement->sSumRealLights[1];
00954       pNewMapElement->sHeight                                     = pOldMapElement->sHeight;
00955       pNewMapElement->ubTerrainID                           = pOldMapElement->ubTerrainID;
00956       pNewMapElement->ubReservedSoldierID = pOldMapElement->ubReservedSoldierID;
00957 
00958       return TRUE;
00959 }
00960 
00961 
00962 BOOLEAN SwapMapElementWithWorld( INT32 iMapIndex, MAP_ELEMENT *pUndoMapElement )
00963 {
00964       MAP_ELEMENT             *pCurrentMapElement;
00965       MAP_ELEMENT             TempMapElement;
00966 
00967       pCurrentMapElement = &gpWorldLevelData[ iMapIndex ];
00968 
00969       //Transfer the merc level node from the current world to the undo mapelement
00970       //that will replace it.  We do this, because mercs aren't associated with
00971       //undo commands.
00972       pUndoMapElement->pMercHead = gpWorldLevelData[ iMapIndex ].pMercHead;
00973       gpWorldLevelData[ iMapIndex ].pMercHead = NULL;
00974       
00975       //Swap the mapelements
00976       TempMapElement = *pCurrentMapElement;
00977       *pCurrentMapElement = *pUndoMapElement;
00978       *pUndoMapElement = TempMapElement;
00979 
00980       return ( TRUE );
00981 }
00982 
00983 void DetermineUndoState()
00984 {
00985       // Reset the undo command mode if we released the left button.
00986       if( !fNewUndoCmd )
00987       {
00988             if( !gfLeftButtonState  && !gfCurrentSelectionWithRightButton || 
00989                     !gfRightButtonState &&  gfCurrentSelectionWithRightButton )
00990             {
00991                   //Clear the mapindex binary tree list, and set up flag for new undo command.
00992                   fNewUndoCmd = TRUE;
00993                   ClearUndoMapIndexTree();
00994             }
00995       }
00996 }
